name: 張素薰
objective:
本課程強調全方位的國際商用英語溝通。現今各領域上之商業活動多以英語進行，因此本課程注重發展學生以英語文進行流暢之溝通的關鍵能力，特別強調商業組織內外部常見的正式溝通之形式，包括商用英語寫作、簡報與會議技巧。課時也納入非正式溝通技巧，指導學生學習應對職場情境，因應相關之溝通需求。
This current course emphasizes a holistic view of business communication in a global context.  Given that business communication across from fields of business activities is now made possible by the English language, the course thus aims to develop the ability to use critical skills essential to successful communication in English, with particular emphases on forms of formal communications that are highly visible within and outside business organizations, including writing of business correspondence and reports, presentations and meetings. Informal communication skills are also incorporated to address workplace situations to identify the relevant communication needs.
schedule:
Course Description:
This course develops students' ability to communicate effectively in business settings using English. Through practice in writing, speaking, and listening, students will learn how to create professional emails, participate in meetings, deliver presentations, and adapt to intercultural workplace communication.
________________________________________
Learning Outcomes:
By the end of this course, students will be able to:
•	Write clear and professional business documents (emails, memos, reports).
•	Communicate effectively in meetings and negotiations.
•	Deliver confident and structured presentations.
•	Understand and adapt to cultural differences in international business.
•	Use English appropriately in business-related speaking and writing contexts.


Syllabus for Business Communication in English 2025 (1)
Week	Topic
1	Course Introduction & Icebreakers
2	Professional Email Writing
3	Business Vocabulary & Formal Language
4	Making Phone Calls & Leaving Voicemails
5	Business Small Talk & Networking
6	Writing Business Reports & Memos
7	Meetings I – Participating Effectively
8	Meetings II – Leading and Organizing
9	Midterm Review & Practice
10	MIDTERM ASSESSMENT
11	Giving Presentations I – Structure & Planning
12	Giving Presentations II – Delivery Skills
13	Cross-Cultural Communication
14	Writing a CV and Cover Letter
15	Job Interviews
16	Group Project Work Day
17	FINAL PRESENTATIONS
18	Course Review & Reflection
